Title: Historians challenge erasure of women from Africa’s intellectual story
Summary: Historians decry the longstanding erasure of women from Africa’s intellectual history . They warn colonial legacies and text-centric traditions have silenced women's contributions to the continent's story .

Title: Police uncover suspected human flesh, abandoned vehicle in Oyo
Summary: Police uncover suspected human flesh, abandoned vehicle in Oyo . Oyo State Police Command reaffirmed the importance of its ongoing Stop-and-Search operations . The Command, in a statement on Thursday, disclosed that one vehicle was abandoned .

Title: Couple, daughter released after N50m ransom payment in Katsina
Summary: Anas Ahmadu, 33, was abducted along with his wife, Halimatu, and their daughter in Katsina State . The couple were released after the alleged payment of N50 million ransom by their family members .

Title: Benue stakeholders cite jobs, infrastructure as cure for insecurity
Summary: A section of stakeholders from Benue State have identified the need to create job opportunities and fix the infrastructural deficit as panacea to the spate of insecurity in the state . The stakeholders, irrespective of their political leanings, bared their minds .

Title: Suspension elapsed, allow Natasha back, NBA tells Senate
Summary: Nigerian Bar Association urges Senate to allow Natasha Akpoti-Uduaghan to resume her duties . NBA President Afam Osigwe, SAN, emphasised that, despite ongoing protests, the NBA has urged the Senate to let her back .

Title: FG, states, LGs share N2.25trn August revenue
Summary: The N2.25 trillion distributable revenue comprised N1.48 trillion statutory revenue and N672.90 billion VAT . N672 billion VAT revenue was also raised in August .

Title: Police arrest Islamic cleric with suspected human flesh in Ibadan
Summary: Suspect claimed to have bought suspected human flesh in Lagos . Oyefeso said that the suspect, when quizzed, claimed to be from Nigeria .

Title: I won’t borrow to fund projects — Uba Sani
Summary: Governor Uba Sani of Kaduna State has assured that his administration will not resort to borrowing to finance projects . Governor Sani: I won't borrow to fund projects .

Title: FCT police boss meets with Miyetti Allah, moves to end cattle roaming
Summary: FCT Police Commissioner of Police, CP Saka Adewale, held a meeting with Miyetti Allah Cattle Breeders Association . The meeting is a bid to bring an end to the troubling incidents of herdsmen taking their cattle around the federal capital city centre .

Title: Nigeria’s inflation figure at 20.7% highest in W’Africa, can’t take us to Promised Land – Adebayo
Summary: Nigeria’s inflation figure at 20.7% highest in W’Africa, can’t take us to Promised Land – Adebayo . Benin Republic has less than two percent inflation figure, Senegal with less than three percent, Tanzania at 3.3 percent .
